ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Re: Idempotency of PUT when using IF-MATCH
ygData.msgSnippet: Side-effects aside.  The original question is one I d like to see answered as well. If the server returns a 4xx response, I would expect the client to fetch

Side-effects aside.  The original question is one I'd like to see  
answere=
d as well.

If the server returns a 4xx response, I would expect the client=
 to  
fetch the most recent ETag and try again, which is unnecessary overhe=
ad.

Question is: if nobody can make a definitive observation that the  
cl=
ient's pre-condition failed, should the server still report it?


- Steve

=
--------------
Steve G. Bjorg
http://wiki.mindtouch.com
http://wiki.opengar=
den.org


On Dec 28, 2007, at 7:36 AM, Aristotle Pagaltzis wrote:

> * Juli=
an Reschke <julian.reschke@...> [2007-12-28 14:45]:
> > So yes, PUT isn'=
t idempotent when used as a conditional request.
>
> =85 eh?
>
> Idempotenc=
y is defined in terms of side effects, and a repeatedly
> sent conditional =
PUT certainly *does not* have cumulative side
> effects.
>
> Regards,
> -- =

> Aristotle Pagaltzis // <http://plasmasturm.org/>
>
> 


--Apple-Mail-8--641301203
